subclassFeature.name: Oath of Brotherhood
entries: Every Paladin answers a call, but while some are driven by their oath to a particular god or pantheon, the Brotherhood are initiated into the secrets and mysteries of the source of Knowledge and Magic. These arcane protectors ensure that magic is used safely and prudently; some of them seek out and correct those who are reckless with their power. Some are dedicated guardians at universities and mages' guilds, others are loyal bodyguards of travelling wizards. Some are seekers of ancient magical relics. Whatever their calling, all know the power of arcane magic and that such power is dangerous.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of the Oath of Brotherhood
entries: Sometimes called the "Bro Code" by common folk – are as old as civilization. This oath emphasizes the principles of camaraderie and spirited competition for the betterment of all involved.

entries.name: Always stand by your Bro
entries: So long as your bro upholds the tenets of this oath, stand by them in victory and defeat, for in victory there is glory, and in defeat there is a good laugh and story to be shared later.

entries.name: Respect your Bro
entries: Be there for your bro, even when your bro isn't there for himself. Never let your bro sacrifice dignity, and always enable your bro to be his best self.

entries.name: Call out a Bro
entries: Sometimes a bro may stray from their duties. It is the responsibility of a bro to ensure that they get back on the right path and remain true to themselves, because they would do the same for you.

entries.name: Support your Bro
entries: Sometimes the best thing you can do for your bro is to lend an ear and offer a kind word. All emotions, whether positive or negative, have a healthy outlet.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: When you take this oath at 3rd level, you gain the following two Channel Divinity options.

entries.name: Call to Arms
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to imbue an ally with renewed vigor and confidence. As an action, you can compel a willing ally that you can see within 30 feet of you to use their reaction to immediately make a melee attack.

entries.name: Share the Burden
entries: If an ally that you can see within 60 feet is the target of a melee or ranged attack, you can use your reaction to teleport to your ally's space and cause your willing ally to teleport into your space. You then become the target of that attack and reduce any damage taken as a result of that attack by half.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Fraternity
entries: By 7th level, your presence becomes a force of unyielding brotherhood. When a friendly creature other than you within 10 feet takes damage, you can use your reaction to magically reduce that damage by half. That creature can then use its reaction to move up to half its movement speed without provoking an attack of opportunity.
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Mark of Brotherhood
entries: Starting at level 15, you can use a bonus action to mark a friendly creature within 60 feet of you for up to 1 minute. Whenever that creature takes damage, the attacker takes psychic damage equal to your charisma modifier (minimum of 1) if you're not incapacitated and can see the hostile creature.
Only 1 creature can be under this effect at any time. You can use this ability an amount of times equal to your charisma modifier (minimum of 1). You regain expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: True Wingman
entries: At 20th level, you gain the ability to transform yourself into the embodiment of brotherhood. Using an action, you undergo a transformation. For 1 hour, you gain the following benefits:
Wings sprout from your back and grant you a flying speed of 60 feet.
You emanate an aura of solidarity with a radius of 30 feet. When an ally starts their turn in this aura, they regain HP equal to your charisma modifier (minimum of 1) if they are not incapacitated.
After you attack a target on your turn, all allies within 30 feet of you may immediately use a reaction to attack a target within range.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.
